edge: Randy 'The Ram' Robinson is a professional wrestler.
Robin Ramzinski, better known by his ring name Randy 'The Ram' Robinson,
Randy 'The Ram' Robinson wrestles on weekends for independent promotions in New Jersey.
Randy 'The Ram' Robinson lives in a trailer park.
Randy wrestles part-time at a supermarket under Wayne, a demeaning manager who mocks Randy's wrestling background.
After winning a local match, Randy agrees to a proposed 20th-anniversary rematch with his most notable opponent, 'The Ayatollah', which Randy hopes could return him to stardom.
After wrestling in a hardcore match, Randy suffers a heart attack backstage and undergoes coronary artery bypass surgery.
Randy's doctor informs him that he nearly died and has to stop taking steroids, and also warns Randy not to wrestle anymore, as his heart can no longer handle the exertion.
Randy visits his estranged daughter Stephanie, whom he had abandoned when she was a child, but she rebuffs him.
At Cassidy's suggestion, Randy visits his estranged daughter Stephanie,
Cassidy reveals that she has a son.
Randy makes romantic advances toward her, which she rejects on the grounds of her job.
gift giver and recipient, Stephanie initially expects gift from Randy but later he gives it to his daughter
employer-employee relationship, Cassidy is Stephanie's boss at the store
romantic advances and rejection, Randy tries to court Cassidy but she rejects him due to job
job-related interaction, Stephanie asks Cassidy to find her a gift for Stephanie's birthday
parent-child relationship, Cassidy has a son
parent-child relationship, Randy reveals having a daughter
professional interaction, Cassidy owns the strip club where Randy goes to apologize
sexual interaction, Randy has sex with a prostitute in a women's restroom
recognition, customer recognizes Randy as wrestler at the deli counter
location, Randy goes to a deli counter to apologize to Stephanie
insulting interaction, Randy insults customers and Wayne at the store after cutting his hand on the slicer
Randy has a heart condition that causes chest pain and unsteadiness during his wrestling match, despite Cassidy's pleas to cancel the match.
Cassidy accompanies Randy to the wrestling event and tries to persuade him not to participate because of his heart condition. However, Randy ignores her request.
The Ayatollah advises Randy to end the match due to his chest pain and unsteadiness, but Randy disregards this advice.
Cassidy exits the venue before Randy completes his match.
Randy is cheered by the crowd during his wrestling match, which gives him a sense of belonging and happiness.
